answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
Charlottesville, VA has an Sidewalk Cafes section of Code within the Streets and Sidewalks regulations. The cafes bustle through much of the year, and the ordinance treats potential commons problems of noise, litter, and upkeep. We have an open container ordinance, and the cafe ordinance prescribes the conversion of public sidewalk to business space such that the open container ordinance no longer applies.
Ordinance 28:6 : http://library.municode.com/index.aspx?clientID=12078&stateID=46&statename=Virginia

answers.author: Jayme Bosio
answers.text:
The City of West Palm Beach, FL, Code of Ordinances (Chapter 78-341 to 78-351) provides detailed "Sidewalk Cafe" regulations used in both the CityPlace and Clematis Street entertainment districts. The Sidewalk Cafe section includes definitions, permits, fees, standards, criteria and conditions, and revocation information. Use the Municipal Code Corp. (MCC) web site geographic browser to access the WPB code: http://www.municode.com/ .

author: Jeffrey Trinker
text:
My city is in the process of establishing a cultural district in our historic downtown area, and we are interested in developing a sidewalk cafe / outdoor dining ordinance to complement the cultural activities.  The ordinance primarily would address code and standards issues related to outdoor dining on sidewalk areas as well as issues related to outdoor alcohol consumption (open containers are currently prohibited downtown).
I have found some excellent sidewalk cafe ordinances so far in my research, but  I was hoping that ICMA members might point me towards some I might not have found yet.
Thanks in advance.
title: Sidewalk cafe / outdoor dining ordinances?
